items.title: Rogue wave analysis supports investigation of the El Faro sinking
items.summary: A new analysis done to support the investigation into the 2015 sinking of the El Faro cargo ship has calculated the likelihood of a massive rogue wave during Hurricane Joaquin in October of that year â€“ and demonstrated a new technique for evaluating the probability of rogue waves over space and time.

alternate.title: Rogue wave analysis supports investigation of the El Faro sinking

thumbnail.title: Rogue wave analysis supports investigation of the El Faro sinking

items.title: Getting emotional after failure helps you improve next time, study finds
items.summary: Emotional responses to failure rather than cognitive ones are more effective at improving people's results for the next time they tackle the next related task, new research indicates.

alternate.title: Getting emotional after failure helps you improve next time, study finds

thumbnail.title: Getting emotional after failure helps you improve next time, study finds

items.title: Fluorescence microscopy on a chip: no lenses required
items.summary: Fluorescence microscopy gives researchers incredible power to illuminate the tiniest structures and capture the real-time activities of live cells by tagging biological molecules with a veritable rainbow of fluorescent dyes. This power comes at a cost: The technology can be expensive and time-consuming and, so far, has resisted attempts at automation.

alternate.title: Fluorescence microscopy on a chip: no lenses required

items.title: Antibiotics following C-section among obese women reduces risk of surgical infection
items.summary: Among obese women undergoing cesarean delivery, a postoperative 48-hour course of antibiotics significantly decreased the rate of surgical site infection within 30 days after delivery, according to a study.

alternate.title: Antibiotics following C-section among obese women reduces risk of surgical infection
